If neither \( A \) or \( B \) is regular, then \( A \cup B \) is also not regular. If \( A \) and \( B \) are not regular languages and \( C \) is a language such that \( A \subseteq C \subseteq B \), then \( C \) is not regular. An infinite regular language \( L \) can be splited into two infinite disjoint, nonempty, regular subsets \( L_1, L_2 \).
